revised_title: The Role of Lymphatic Vessels in Absorption and the Venous System
tldr: The author discusses the role of lymphatic vessels in the body's absorption process and their connection to the venous system. He argues that the lymphatic vessels are not primarily responsible for absorption, but rather work alongside the veins to maintain a balance in the body's fluids. The author also explains the importance of endosmosis in facilitating capillary circulation.
